attachments.title: ANN: Announcing DoctorDocstrings.jl
attachments.text: Hello all! DoctorDocstrings.jl is a package that will help you enhance your REPL workflow for adding docstrings to your package. It is very simple, alpha, and hardcoded (for now). Dear lord don’t judge me from the janky hacks it’s awful awful. But it works! The idea is to listdocs($MyPackage) to know see all exports in your package/module and true/false for having docstrings/examples. diagnosedocs($MyPackage) if you only want to know the ones that are missing docstrings Now that you know ...

messages.text: Put it on its own line for a “onebox”

messages.text: Is it somehow possible to auto-switch between light and dark theme of our discourse depending on my macos system mode? That would be awesome… Manual switching takes way too many clicks.

elements.text: Is it somehow possible to auto-switch between light and dark theme of our discourse depending on my macos system mode? That would be awesome… Manual switching takes way too many clicks.

messages.text: Firefox shows me there's some kind of Facebook tracking running on the Julia Discourse. Due to it being blocked, I don't actually know what it is. Whatever it is, is it really needed or could it be disabled? The privacy policy does not mention it unfortunately.

elements.text: Firefox shows me there's some kind of Facebook tracking running on the Julia Discourse. Due to it being blocked, I don't actually know what it is. Whatever it is, is it really needed or could it be disabled? The privacy policy does not mention it unfortunately.

messages.text: The icon shows up after scrolling a bit, it might be a false positive too?

elements.text: The icon shows up after scrolling a bit, it might be a false positive too?

messages.text: there definitely should not be a facebook tracker

elements.text: there definitely should not be a facebook tracker

messages.text: I only see <http://discourse.julialang.org|discourse.julialang.org> and <http://discourse-cdn.com|discourse-cdn.com> domains being hit
it’d be interesting to figure out what’s triggering that

elements.text: it’d be interesting to figure out what’s triggering that

messages.text: It's the Share on Facebook button that triggers it (I clicked on just about any UI element to find that):

elements.text: It's the Share on Facebook button that triggers it (I clicked on just about any UI element to find that):

messages.text: Which apparently is loaded in advance before you even open the Share menu

elements.text: Which apparently is loaded in advance before you even open the Share menu

messages.text: Okay, I think it's just a false positive then because Firefox thinks that it's one of FB's first party buttons that actually has tracking logic

elements.text: Okay, I think it's just a false positive then because Firefox thinks that it's one of FB's first party buttons that actually has tracking logic
